pr_title: Changes in metadata required to update the app to API 29

timeline.message: Replaced value of deviceID with installID
No longer treat deviceId property as dangerous

timeline.bodyText: What effect does having SCHEME_IMEI here have? Seems it should be collect, maybe?
timeline.author: lognaturel

replies.bodyText:
That's a good question, I wanted to ask about it because I'm not sure... I kept SCHEME_IMEI for now but it's not IMEI anymore so it doesn't make much sense. I could do what you say and add collect: but our new device id is already like collect:5sf45sf5dsf5d4f (it starts with collect: always) so a result the value with scheme would be collect:collect:5sf45sf5dsf5d4f
Of course depends where we use it because in settings and in a form it would be still just collect:5sf45sf5dsf5d4f (because there we get the value without scheme) but during sending a form we use:
deviceId = new PropertyManager(Collect.getInstance().getApplicationContext())
                    .getSingularProperty(PropertyManager.withUri(PropertyManager.PROPMGR_DEVICE_ID));

what will return doubled collect:
collect:collect:5sf45sf5dsf5d4f 
maybe we should get rid of that prefix collect: which now is a part of device id and add it instead of SCHEME_IMEI so as a result in settings and in a form we would have 5sf45sf5dsf5d4f but sending forms it would be collect:5sf45sf5dsf5d4f?
@lognaturel @seadowg
replies.author: grzesiek2010

replies.bodyText: Interesting, I didn't realize there was that difference between in-form and at submission time. I think they should be consistent and both include the scheme. How about just using the literal String "" as the scheme here?
replies.author: lognaturel

replies.bodyText: That would be a solution, what do you think @seadowg?
replies.author: grzesiek2010

replies.bodyText:
Ah yeah I hadn't realized PropertyManager expects a scheme here. I think passing "" as the scheme makes the most sense to me as because then (as @lognaturel points out) it'll be displayed consistently.
We could then just add a putProperty(String propName, String value) that doesn't append a scheme (or just calls the other putProperty with "").
replies.author: seadowg

replies.bodyText:
Ok, I removed that scheme but I needed to add some extra changes in InstanceServerUploaderTask and InstanceSubmitter where we access that property to avoid using PropertyManager.withUri because then even if the scheme is empty we would have an extra semicolon left, like: :collect:5sf45sf5dsf5d4f .
All the changes are in my last commit:
94e954c
replies.author: grzesiek2010
